concept.title: Running the Publishing Engine Docker Image on AWS

conbody.p: You can create an EC2 instance on the Amazon Cloud Computing AWS platform, run the publishing there if changes are detected in a Git project and publish the content to the same platform.

dlentry.dd: Sign in to create an account on AWS.
Create an EC2 Instance on AWS.

dlentry.dt: Configure the Security Group and Install a Web Server
dlentry.dd: Configure the Security Group associated to the EC2 instance to allow for HTTP or HTTPS connections and install a web server.
Use the AWS Instance Connect to open a console in the web browser to the instance.

dlentry.dt: Install Git in the EC2 instance
dlentry.dd: Run in the console this command to install git:sudo yum install git

dlentry.dt: Install Docker in the EC2 Instance
dlentry.dd: Run in the console this command to install Docker and start the Docker daemon:sudo yum install docker sudo systemctl start docker
Create a local clone of the Git project by running this command in the console:git clone https://github.com/oxygenxml/blog.git
Change directory to the folder containing the Dockerfile and run Docker to create an image.cd blog/build sudo docker image build -t oxygen-publishing-engine:1.0 .

dlentry.dt: Save the Oxygen Publishing Engine License to a file
dlentry.dd: Save the Oxygen Publishing Engine to a file for example in /home/ec2-user/licensekey.txt.

dlentry.dt: Run the Docker Image to Publish
